page.title: 09EDUCATION IN STURTON 1
page.content: THERE IS A{PRIMARY SCHOOL}FOR 5-11 YEAR OLDS,WITH 1OO PUPILS & 4 FULL TIME TEACHERS. THE MAJORITY OF PUPILS LIVE WITHIN 2 MILES OF THE SCHOOL. A FEW ARE BUSSED FROM THE VILLAGES OF NORTH AND SOUTH CARLTON. IN THE GAINSBOROUGH & STURTON CATCHMENT AREA,A SELECTIVE SYSTEM OPERATES. SELECTION AT 11+ RESULTS IN THE MOST ACADEMICALLY ABLE CHILDREN ATTENDING THE{GRAMMAR SCHOOL}IN GAINSBOROUGH. THE OTHER 75% ATTEND ONE OF 3{SECONDARY MODERN SCHOOLS}OF WHICH ONE IS SITED IN STURTON. THIS SCHOOL FOR 11-16 YEAR OLDS HAS 400 PUPILS AND 26 STAFF. PUPILS LIVING FURTHER THAN 3 MILES FROM THE SCHOOL ARE BUSSED. FOR EDUCATION BEYOND 16 YEARS CHILDREN HAVE TO ATTEND SCHOOL OR COLLEGE ELSEWHERE. SCHOOL LUNCHES COOKED AT THE SECONDARY SCHOOL ARE SERVED IN BOTH SCHOOLS.
